comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Elsie Viola Kachel Stevens (1886-1963), wife of poet Wallace Stevens (1879-1955), was the model for the depiction of Liberty on the "Mercury Dime", designed by Adolph Weinman and in circulation 1916-1945: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mercury_dime en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wallace_Stevens

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: On the other hand... there's also a debutante named Miss Elsie Stevens who turns up in society reports of 1915-16. She's mentioned right between Barbara Rutherfurd and Mrs. Joseph Stevens in one report from March 1916--and both Rutherfurd and Mrs. Stevens also appear in this week's batch. So hmmm. And is this the same debutante Elsie Stevens, or a third woman with the name? news.google.com/newspapers?id=badVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=pOADA...

comment.author: 8139976@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/11418107@N02] This Elsie Stevens must be the debutante. Her parents were Mr. and Mrs. Richard Stevens of Newport, based on the newspaper article you quote, and another Bain negatives from the same set (#3515), showing Mrs. Forman, is mistakenly titled Mrs. Richard Stevens: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/8079898592/in/contacts/] Here's a picture of the poet's wife, Elsie Stevens, née Kachel: www.wallacestevensbiography.com/pics/Elsie-Stevens-by-bri...

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
Pennyrichardsca:

I think you are correct that this image depicts debutante Elsie Stevens whose parents were Mr. and Mrs. Richard Stevens of Newport.  We will add more details when we update the description.  Thank you for your source citations and images!
